MS MCQs

    Automate Node.js deployments with Azure Pipelines - How do Azure and Azure DevOps support Node.js applications?

    »

    1. What kind of source changes will the typical Node.js project require in order to run on Azure?

      Node.js apps will need to be rewritten in C# or another .NET language before they will run properly on Azure.

      Configuration code will have to be rewritten to connect to Azure’s configuration service.

      No changes are required.


    2. How does hosting Node.js apps on Azure differ from hosting apps built for other platforms (like .NET) on Azure?

      Each app platform has its own dependencies, so developers need to be sure the Azure target they’re using is configured correctly.

      Node.js deployments require use of Node.js performance and monitoring tools.

      Node.js deployments are limited to web sites on Azure.


    3. What databases can a Node.js app deployed on Azure connect to?

      Azure SQL Database is the only option.

      Azure Database for MySQL is the only option.

      They can connect to any database or service.
